title: Derivatives as Rates of Change
body: Assume that the number of barbeque dinners that can be sold, $$x$$, can be related to the price charged, $$p$$, by the equation $$p(x)=9-0.03x$$, $$0$$ $$ \leq $$ $$x$$ $$ \leq $$ $$300$$. In this case, the revenue in dollars obtained by selling $$x$$ barbeque dinners is given by $$R(x)=x p\left(x\right)=x \left(9-0.03x\right)=-0.03x^2+9x$$ for $$0$$ $$ \leq $$ $$x$$ $$ \leq $$ $$300$$.
